file_content.text: Hunter.
Heh... that went wrong, didn't it? Got a hole in my gut.
I'm not going to beg. Turning on someone who did their job is wrong. We both know it.
Here's your writ. It tells the Mandalorians you did your job. And here's your pay. The rest is up to you.
Are you going to send more men after me?
No, it's up to you.
To do what? Add to the body count? My men are no match for you.
How about I make a more concrete apology?
Bribe me, Captain--and do it well.
You can live--for a price.
That, I can do. I've got all sorts of resources at my disposal.
I'll send you some top-of-the-line weaponry as soon as you're out of here. That work for you?
It better be nice, or I'll come back.
I suppose.
Don't worry, that's not something I want.
I'm glad this didn't have to get personal.
Pleasure doing business.
It never was, believe me.
You're everything a woman should be. Wish I'd met you when I was still a man.
You're everything a man should be. I wish I'd... well, it's too late for regrets.
What's done is done. Good hunting to you.
I don't trust you, Captain.
No deal. [Kill him]
Heh... I don't trust me anymore either.
You messed up, Captain. Now you pay for it.
Yes, it is. [Kill him]
This whole place is messed up... glad to be... rid of it....
You got the IDs! Fantastic! Let me see... that's Commander Gargun's, all right.
What was it like in the Dark Temple? I've yet to hear anything that didn't sound like pure raving.
Just some weird lights. No big deal.
I wasn't impressed.
You wouldn't believe me about that place if I told you.
That's about right.
There was an entire society in that temple. Well, kinda.
Lots of people inside.
Huh. Still wish I could have gone in myself. Would have saved me some unpleasantness.
Listen to me, "unpleasantness." I'm even starting to talk like a spy.
Friend, remember when I said Sith didn't want anyone in the Dark Temple?
I remember, all right.
Yes.
Well, you can probably guess the rest.
You're making me unhappy.
I wish there was another way to handle this. I really do.
The Sith are your problem.
I don't remember caring.
Exactly right. I wish they weren't, but the Sith are my problem.
I can't risk the Sith ever finding out you went in their precious Dark Temple--which means you're now a liability.
I apologize. This isn't the way a fighting woman should die. Guards!
I apologize. This isn't the way a fighting man should die. Guards!
Wish I was going with you. The Dark Temple should be all sorts of exciting.
What the--? Oh, right, the bounty hunter. Glad you could make it.
Feeling nervous, alien? Standing in the middle of Imperial Intelligence?
You nervous, hunter? Parked in the middle of Imperial Intelligence and all?
Do I have a reason to be nervous?
I'm here on business.
Our office is fairly progressive when it comes to aliens, but don't ever think you're not being judged.
I don't know. A lot of people get nervous just being around here.
This place is a bit creepy.
A little, yes.
You can say that again.
This is Imperial Intelligence? I thought it was a Jedi training camp!
Don't be stupid.
Hmph. I'll take that as "no." Careful, though.
I could say one word or touch one button, and you'd disappear forever.
Poof! Gone, just like that. Nobody would even dare to ask what happened to you.
Are you threatening me, Captain?
Is this why I'm here?
What? Nah, just showing you what I deal with all day.
Go ahead. Say the word and see what happens.
Just try it.
Ha! Nicely done. I like you, hunter, I really do.
That's a lot of responsibility for one man.
Quite a job you've got.
I knew you'd understand--makes your head spin, doesn't it?
I never signed up for this cloak-and-dagger stuff. I was a regular soldier.
Then one day, I put together a covert op raid that goes a little too well and--bam! I'm in Imperial Intelligence.
You didn't want to be a spy?
Promoted against your will?
Who would? Put my enemy in front of me and hand me a blaster--that's all I ask.
What do you mean, "goes a little too well"?
I don't understand.
Standard procedure when a grunt finds information deemed too sensitive is to eliminate the grunt. I wasn't so lucky.
Just give me my target so I can get to the killing.
Spare me your life story.
Your target is probably already dead.
Look, what I'm saying is the stuff that goes on in these halls is insane, and all of it is crazy hush-hush.
So what I'm going to tell you has to stay just between you and me. Got it?
My price tag always includes the cost of discretion.
All part of the service.
If that's how you want it.
It'd help if you ever actually told me something.
Just get to the point!
Here's the deal: There's a huge ancient Sith temple on Dromund Kaas. Used to just sit there being scary.
Now the place is crawling with Sith sorcery, and it's been ordered a no-go zone for everyone. Naturally, we sent a team in.
My commander led that team. Nobody came back. We can't report any of them dead without reporting the mission--which puts me in a bind.
I still don't see what you need me for.
So what's my job?
Why is it important to report those people dead?
How so?
We need to explain them being gone, but that's not all of it.
Why do I get the feeling I'm going to the temple?
I see where this is going.
Because you've got warrior instincts. Like me.
If I can't prove my commander's dead, I can't take over his spot--which means an ugly power vacuum.
I'm hiring you to enter that temple and find the teams' ID cards--especially my commander's. I need those IDs to create more "acceptable" deaths for them.
What if this commander and his team are still alive?
What if they're alive?
They're not. And even if they are... they're not. Understood?
Go to temple, get ID. Got it.
I tell you, I envy you getting to do the fun part.
Can you even keep all this intrigue straight?
Quite a conspiracy.
Sometimes yes, sometimes no. All I can do is try and stay on top of the pile.
Make sure you find an Imperial commander named Gargun. Can't imagine there will be more than one corpse in the temple wearing commander stripes.
Grab all the teams' ID cards and double-time it back here. Quietly.
This is Imperial Intelligence. You supposed to be in here?
Nice to see ya.
